title: Hort — Plot. Sans Serif + Typewriter
content:
Anyone know the combination that HORT use on the identity for PLOT?  
Is the sans serif Apercu? The typewriter is not Pitch at least. Could it just be Courier? Any other ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417082529im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Plot_CI_Web_006_4229.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417082529im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Plot_CI_Web_002_3777.jpg)

Font: 

 Alte Haas Grotesk + Courier 

Solved By: 

 [Renko](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417082529/http:/typophile.com/user/12000 "View user profile.")
author: SodaPopinski

comments.content:
As they are using [Alte Haas Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417082529/http:/www.dafont.com/alte-haas-grotesk.font?psize=s&text=GbR+Reinsburgstr+711) in their [media PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417082529/http:/www.plotmag.com/mediadaten/PLOTmedia_2013.pdf) I assume they are using it as the Sans Serif above, too. Alte Haas Grotesk is basically Helvetica with sort of an antique touch.

The typewriter below looks indeed like Courier.

Many thanks Renko.  
I've marked it as solved with your credits.  
Cheers!
